isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: ROCKWELL WABCO 4 CHANNEL - TROUBLESHOOTING - USING THE BLINK CODE

svcsubproc.title: Service Alert
svcsubproc.para: An ABS warning lamp on the instrument panel alerts the driver of a possible system malfunction. If the ABS light stays on during normal vehicle operation, the driver knows the vehicle needs to be serviced.

step1.para: Make sure the vehicle voltage is between 11 and 15 volts.
Turn the blink code switch on. The blink code begins after 5 seconds.

svcsubproc.title: Blink Code Examples
svcsubproc.para: Figure 8and Figure 9show examples of a blink code.
If the ignition and blink code switch remain on, the blink code will continue to repeat, beginning with the 2.5 seconds start flash and ending with a 2.5 second pause.
When the blink code is activated and there are no faults in the ECU memory, the blink code 2-0-0 will be displayed ( Figure 9).

note.para: If a blink code is displayed that is not in the Blink Code Diagnostics, then do the following:

step1.para: Try to erase the fault from the ECU memory.
If the fault does not erase from the ECU memory, there could be a problem with the ECU.

svcsubproc.title: Erasing a Fault From The ECU Memory

note.para: An existing fault cannot be erased until it has been corrected.

svcsubproc.para: Erase all faults from the ECU memory after they have been noted and corrected.
Faults can be erased one at a time. A fault is erased from the ECU memory by doing the following:

step1.para: Turn the blink code switch off ( Figure 7).
Wait until the blink code light stops flashing.
Turn the ignition OFF, then ON.
Activate the blink code switch ( Figure 7).
Count the blink codes flashes and write down the blink code.
Find the blink code in the BLINK CODE DIAGNOSTICS CHART. If the blink code is 2-0-0, then there are no faults in the ABS.
Erase the blink code from the ECU memory.
